channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-10608] Acquire the FS Delegation Token for Secure ExportSnapshot
item.description: Export Snapshot is missing the delegation token acquisition for working with remote secure clusters
item.summary: Acquire the FS Delegation Token for Secure ExportSnapshot

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Looks reasonable to me. Nice test too. Does the change in the runCopyJob params break existing jobs Matteo Bertozzi? You had a chance to test it on a cluster?

I'd be +1 if the runCopyJob change is not disruptive and haoopqa passes.

runCopyJob() is just a private method of the ExportSnapshot "main" class..
so it shouldn't break anything since is not even part of the Mapper, or am I missing something?
I tried to run it on a secure cluster, but not with mixed version RS.. but I don't think the change is incompatible in any way
Ok. Thanks. +1

+1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12631024/HBASE-10608-v0.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12631024

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 5 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop1.1. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.1 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8804//testReport/

Needed in 0.94 too?

  • /hbase/branches/0.96/hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/mapreduce/LoadIncrementalHFiles.java

In /hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/security/token/FsDelegationToken.java the package is declared as
package org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security; !!

In /hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/security/token/FsDelegationToken.java the package is declared as package org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security;

Whoops. Good spotting.

Two things:

  • This issue should have been resolved after the commits.
  • Well, anyway, now it's "reopened" needing an addendum looks like.

Lars Hofhansl I was thinking at a strip down version of the patch for 94, due to the separate security module. with the FsTokenDelegation class embedded into the Export, as the LoadIncrementalHFile is doing (see 94-v0.patch)

Anoop Sam John good catch, thanks! attached the addendum
+1 on addendum

was thinking at a strip down version of the patch for 94, due to the separate security module. with the FsTokenDelegation class embedded into the Export, as the LoadIncrementalHFile is doing (see 94-v0.patch)

This is a backport.

Can we resolve this issue after commit of addendum to trunk, 0.98, and 0.96, and open a new JIRA for a backport?

committed the addendum

closing down, and opening another jira for the backport

Matteo Bertozzi Does the addendum address the failing tests we've been seeing up on builds since this went in?

Here is an example: https://builds.apache.org/view/H-L/view/HBase/job/HBase-0.98-on-Hadoop-1.1/173/

Thanks.

stack missed the error
let me look at this.. but looks like something wrong in the the FileSystem.. that is not giving us the token
